subject: Re: Magui’s journey: helping clients see their potential

full_threads.body: (Time: 30mins) - Investigation
@allieB Closing this ticket for now, client asked a question regarding eDMs and it's now confirmed.

Thanks for looking into this for us!

Cameron.Sinclair@sonova.com, please refer to the below.

Thanks,

Christine

Client: Unitron Marketing
Reported Issue: Need to track who downloads a video from the eDM.

Additional Context: Using a direct video link in the eDM results in downloads being attributed to “Anonymous Guest,” preventing accurate tracking of which client accessed the content.

Action Plan Taken:
  • Advised that to capture accurate download data, clients should access the video via the main page, which requires them to log in.
  • Recommended using Microsoft Clarity for deeper tracking insights, as it can capture detailed user interactions including clicks on download links.
  • Offered support to assist with setting up Microsoft Clarity for enhanced visibility.

Conclusion / Next Steps:
  • Client to implement the recommended method for tracking downloads through the main page.
  • Support team available to assist with Microsoft Clarity setup if required.

Hi Christine,

Apologies for the delay on this, we wanted to double-check the system behavior to ensure we could provide a clear and accurate answer.

To answer your question: if a client uses the direct video link, the system likely won’t be able to track who downloaded it. Here’s why:

  • The Direct Link: When a client clicks the direct download link, they usually aren’t logged into the website yet. The system will see them as an “Anonymous Guest” and allow the download, but it won’t record their name in the report.
  • Tracking Solution: To make sure downloads are accurately tracked, we suggest directing clients to the main page first. Once they log in, they can access the content, and the system will record the download against their account, giving you precise engagement data.

For even deeper tracking insights, we’d recommend trying Microsoft Clarity. It captures detailed user interactions, including clicks on download links, giving you better visibility into engagement. We’d be happy to help set it up for you.

For reference, you can direct them to the main page here: https://unitronmarketing.com.au/

If you have any questions or need assistance implementing this, we’re always happy to help!

Hi guys,

If we put in the link below to the video in an eDM, can we still track how many people and who downloaded it? Or will they have to go to the main page, login for this to happen?

https://unitronmarketing.com.au/?jet_download=f0bba14f2010c9740089d4bd895fea13e2c1ee4c

Thanks,

Christine

Client approval received. Closing this conversation.

Support has set a Google Calendar reminder for the go-live.

CC @allieB  @marcelo
Thank you, have a great weekend!

Hi Christine,

You’re very welcome! Always happy to help.

If you need anything else or run into any issues, just let me know, I’m happy to assist.

Thanks Marcelo,

Thought that might be the case since it's a larger file.

Thanks for testing and confirming,

Christine
We’ll close this ticket for now as we’re waiting for her updated image. Once she replies, we will reopen and continue working on the remaining tasks.

Hi Christine,

Just an update, we tested the video download on our end, and the file successfully came through. It took around 4-6 minutes to download, though this may vary depending on internet speed.

See the example below:

Since the video is close to 3GB, a longer download time is expected, as larger files may naturally take more time to transfer across different connections.

If you experience any issues accessing it or need us to provide an alternative download method, just let me know — happy to assist.

Thanks Marcelo,

Does the file take a while to download for you guys? When I tested it, it took some time.

Thanks,

Christine
